target_title: Allow browser search on selected text in Context menu

note.body: Sure, I will get on this very soon. Thanks a lot. <3

target_title: Allow browser search on selected text in Context menu

note.body:
Thank you for opening an issue. I think your request makes sense, and it would be a good non-disruptive addition.

It should be straightforward to implement it (in case you would like to give it a go).

target_title: Tabbed PDF Viewer

note.body:
Thank you for taking time to open an issue. The request is a duplicated of issue #182.

More importantly, please read the comments in https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=306060, especially the one from Bryan Clarke (the original UX designer of Evince).

That said, I am personally aware of the request, and I am open to revisit it at some point. It is low in the priorities as spare time is scarce.

target_title: Tabbed PDF Viewer
Allow browser search on selected text in Context menu
Tabbed PDF Viewer
Ability to draw shapes (lines, circles, etc.) annotations on PDF

note.body: After reading, researching, and testing, I noticed that Papers has a more active community than Evince. As a newcomer to the open-source community, I believe this will be more beneficial for me. Therefore, I will focus on working with features similar to those in Papers.

target_title: Ability to draw shapes (lines, circles, etc.) annotations on PDF

note.body: Would you think it would be better to work on this addition directly in Papers, since there is already a movement for its creation (and from what I've researched, Papers can replace Evince as the default document reader for GNOME), or would it be better to do it directly in Evince since it is the foundation of Papers (I am not aware of how much Papers still relies on Evince)?

target_title: Ability to draw shapes (lines, circles, etc.) annotations on PDF

note.body:
Thank you for saying that, I will keep an eye on this work being done on the papers.

That said, my plan was to create a tool that basically implements the functionality of GNOME/Incubator/papers#318 and GNOME/Incubator/papers#236, as both would be useful to me in my daily use of this tool.

target_title: Ability to draw shapes (lines, circles, etc.) annotations on PDF

note.body:
@Schlemuel you may be interested to know that work from @lbaudin is [underway](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/Incubator/papers/-/merge_requests/298) in Papers (the Evince fork) to implement new types of annotations over there, at least when it comes to [free-standing text boxes](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/Incubator/papers/-/issues/129), which _might_ be not too far from this technically, I presume.

Your comments here made me realize now that I had forgot to write a corresponding ticket in Papers for the shapes annotations specifically, so I filed https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/Incubator/papers/-/issues/318 now. I kept it separate from the freehand ink annotation ticket (https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/Incubator/papers/-/issues/236) because I think that one is more complex to achieve.

target_title: File options menu doesn't close after click "Present as slide show"
Scrolling through new page jumps too far

note.body: I've also noticed that when I select a portion of text, the scrolling becomes much less smooth. (using v46.3.1)

target_title: Vertical scroll only option

note.body:
I think that would help but doesn't quite cover it. I can think of two situations:

- Documents that have extra elements (like page numbers, notices, art, etc)  outside of the main text margins
- Scanned documents where this auto-detection may fail due to scanning quality

So it would still be valuable to have vertical only scrolling, or some resistance to horizontal scrolling on touchscreens.

target_title: Vertical scroll only option

note.body:
Thank you for taking time to report this issue. Maybe your inquiry can be solved differently, with something that other pdf viewers provide which is "Fit to text" and that is long overdue in Evince to do it. This way there would not be horizontal scroll.

See issue #3. Would this make sense for you?

target_title: Vertical scroll only option
Webp images hidden in .cbz with both webp and jpg files

note.body: Nope, I'm an idiot, I apologize to everyone wasting their time reading this. This problem occurs due to the installed version of Document Viewer from the arch repos, NOT from the flatpak. The second I double checked withing my software center which instance of the software I had installed I realized my mistake. Reinstalling the document viewer from flathub immediately solved the probelm.

target_title: Feature request: anti-highlighter

note.body:
If I understand correctly, the feature would be similar to those applied to make some documents confidential, by removing the sensitive parts.

In the meantime, you can try:

Use a darker color, for example black. The height of the annotation may result in something annoying, or maybe something good enough. YMMV.

Another alternative is to use white, but play with the opacity by moving the slider in the annotation properties window (right click on the annotation, and select "Annotation properties" from the contextual menu).

target_title: Ability to draw shapes (lines, circles, etc.) annotations on PDF

note.body:
You may want to start by looking at https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/poppler/poppler/-/blob/master/glib/demo/annots.c?ref_type=heads

if you build Poppler from source code, you will have `poppler-glib-demo` which showcases what you can do with the glib API of Poppler. Then, the code needs to be integrated within the logic of Evince.

also opening txt files through gio open "davs:..." do not crash gvfs.
It happens with a pdf file calling evince.

target_title: evince crashes when opening a fine on nextcloud davfs

note.body:
It is my own personal nextcloud server
running 30.0.0

I looked more into it.
In the file manager when i right click on a file and say open with google it displays correctly in google.
with a path looking like 
`file:///run/user/1020/gvfs/dav:host=...FILENAME.pdf`
when the file is open using evince.
The file path is instead
`file:///tmp/evince-23066/document.R750V2-FILENAME.pdf`
with error : `Unable to open document "file:///tmp/evince-23066/document.R750V2-FILENAME.pdf" The name is not activatable.`

Looking around i tried to open not from the file manager but from the command line:
`gio open "davs://USER@SRVER/remote.php/webdav/PATH/FILENAME.pdf"`
It open evince with the error above, and in the shell there is a gvfs warning.
```
(evince:23066): GVFS-WARNING **: 13:26:32.812: The peer-to-peer connection failed: Remote peer disconnected. Falling back to the session bus. Your application is probably missing --filesystem=xdg-run/gvfsd privileges.
Then the gvfsd-dav is killed.

Oct 27 13:26:32 joran gvfsd-dav[22867]: g_object_ref: assertion 'G_IS_OBJECT (object)' failed
Oct 27 13:26:32 joran audit[22867]: ANOM_ABEND auid=1000 uid=1000 gid=1000 ses=3 subj=unconfined_u:unconfined_r:unconfined_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 pid=22867 comm="pool" exe="/usr/libexec/gvfsd-dav" sig=11 res=1
Oct 27 13:26:32 joran kernel: pool[23064]: segfault at a8 ip 00007f0f18acd6d9 sp 00007f0f051ffa40 error 4 in libgvfsdaemon.so[a6d9,7f0f18ac3000+16000] likely on CPU 10 (core 20, socket 0)
Oct 27 13:26:32 joran systemd-coredump[23085]: Process 22867 (gvfsd-dav) of user 1000 terminated abnormally with signal 11/SEGV, processing...
Oct 27 13:26:32 joran systemd-coredump[23086]: Process 22867 (gvfsd-dav) of user 1000 dumped core.
                                               Module libgvfscommon.so from rpm gvfs-1.56.1-1.fc41.x86_64
                                               Module libgvfsdaemon.so from rpm gvfs-1.56.1-1.fc41.x86_64
                                               Module gvfsd-dav from rpm gvfs-1.56.1-1.fc41.x86_64
                                               #0  0x00007f0f18acd6d9 g_vfs_job_run (libgvfsdaemon.so + 0xa6d9)
                                               #3  0x00005584209a3770 daemon_main.constprop.0 (gvfsd-dav + 0xd770)
                                               #4  0x0000558420999aec main (gvfsd-dav + 0x3aec)
                                               #7  0x0000558420999b95 _start (gvfsd-dav + 0x3b95)
░░ Subject: Process 22867 (gvfsd-dav) dumped core
░░ Process 22867 (gvfsd-dav) crashed and dumped core.
Oct 27 13:26:34 joran abrt-notification[23151]: Process 13977 (gvfsd-dav) crashed in g_vfs_job_run()
░░ Subject: ABRT has detected unexpected termination: gvfsd-dav
░░ gvfsd-dav killed by SIGSEGV
░░  #0 g_vfs_job_run at ../daemon/gvfsjob.c:195
```

target_title: Ability to draw shapes (lines, circles, etc.) annotations on PDF

note.body:
I'm thinking of adding this feature myself. Although I don't have experience with C and GTK applied in C, I believe I can complete this task before the rc release of GNOME 49, or even before the alpha release.

Additionally, I was wondering if someone would be willing to be my mentor for the GSoC 2025. As a beginner in working on open-source projects like this, I think having a mentor's guidance would help me complete the project more quickly and efficiently.

Regardless of the response, I still plan to add this functionality.

target_title: Flatpak: PDF does not print

note.body:
To reproduce the problem:
Open Evince Document Viewer, click on a PDF file, click on the printer symbol at top of pull down menu.  Print job sent to printer. Printer sends message that print job is stopped.
![Screenshot_from_2024-10-22_18-54-20](/uploads/0a00d2a0ecf470bc1becebb44ccb3b8e/Screenshot_from_2024-10-22_18-54-20.png)

target_title: Flatpak: PDF does not print

note.body:
Background: POP_OS 22.04LTS, Evince 46.3.1 from flatpak, HP 6960 printer
    • Document Viewer will not print pdf documents
    • My system can print jpeg, png, LibreOffice documents without a problem
    • Loaded Atril Document Viewer and it does print pdf documents
    • All print options work on my laptop EXCEPT printing PDF from Evince does not work
    • A print job from Evince is “stopped” by the printer

target_title: Flatpak: PDF does not print

note.body: I used a different pdf viewer and it prints pdf files, so there is a BIG BUG in Evince Document Viewer.  It will not print or make a printable document available to the printer.

All in separate sections. Thanks!

target_title: Opening web links creates permission denied for xfce4-mime-helper
Opening web links creates permission denied for xfce4-mime-helper
Checkboxes are not independent as they should

note.body: As promised, I'm here to report that the problem has been solved: the Poppler library was fixed 15 hours ago -> https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/poppler/poppler/-/merge_requests/1603#note_5bde50c5dedc0ec6302b32785d60e53730ca2349. One of the next updates of Linux distributions will probably include the poppler library that brings back checkboxes to Evince. This is the fix -> https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/poppler/poppler/-/merge_requests/1603/diffs?commit_id=c6bf2224cac6b9693a390b2655cf9942619919f5.

target_title: usage of --display option

note.body:
> This is with evince 3.36.10 installed on Ubuntu 20.04 from the repository in an Xorg session.

Hi @TentativeConvert, thanks for reporting this. Unfortunately you are using a version that is too old and not supported anymore by GNOME developers. There will not be any bug fixes or feature additions by GNOME developers for the version that you use.

To receive help for code development support questions, configuration or preferences issues, or to answer "[How] Can I do...?" questions, please use https://discourse.gnome.org/ (or the support forum of your distribution, or the chat channel of the project if existing), as GNOME's ticket system is used for actionable feature requests and errors in the code of GNOME software.
I am closing this task as invalid. Thank you for your understanding!
